com.base.engine

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.base.engine.InputHandler

  • public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Adapted from LWJGL 3 tutorial: https://tutorialedge.net/java/lwjgl3/lwjgl-3-keyboard-input-handler-tutorial/ Handles the input from the user (mouse and keyboard)

    • Method Detail

      • invokeKey

        public void invokeKey(long window,
                      int key,
                      int scancode,
                      int action,
                      int mods)
        Callback for keyPress
        Parameters:
        window - window to detect
        key - key that was detected
        scancode - scandcode of key
        action - action of key (pressed/released)
        mods - mods of the key

      • isKeyDown

        public static boolean isKeyDown(int keycode)
        Static boolean method to detect if a given key is pressed
        Parameters:
        keycode - Key to test
        Returns:
        true if key is pressed down

      • isAnyKeyDown

        public static boolean isAnyKeyDown()
        Checks to see if there is any key being pressed at the moment
        Returns:
        true if any key is down, false if there is nothing being pressed

      • isAnyKeyDown

        public static boolean isAnyKeyDown(int keycodeIgnore)
        Checks to see if there is any key being pressed at the moment (ignoring one keycode)
        Parameters:
        keycodeIgnore - The keycode to be ignored
        Returns:
        true if any key is down, false if there is nothing being pressed

      • invokeMouseButton

        public void invokeMouseButton(long window,
                              int button,
                              int action,
                              int mods)
        Callback function for when mouse action is detected
        Parameters:
        window - current window to detect events from
        button - button detected
        action - action of button (pressed/released)
        mods - mods of button

        xPos - the x position
        yPos - the y position
